Question: This person never speaks in his own voice in his dialogues.
Hints: Dicaearchus went so far as to say that this person wrestled at the Isthmian games.
Aristotle attributes a different doctrine with respect to the ideas to this person and Socrates (Metaphysics 987b1–11).
By the 19th century, this person's reputation was restored, and at least on par with Aristotle's.
